reviews.text: Cordial and attentive service. Shout out to Ashley. She knows good spots. The conference rooms are a little small, so be mindful for corporate events. You have to use their valet or be a logistics master with the side parking (that is in short supply in Alexandria). I usually find myself never liking a hotel that doesn’t have a parking lot but these guys are good enough for a five. Rooms are very clean, bright and ample.

Wonderful. Renee at the front desk was absolutely one of my favorite parts of the experience. She is a bright human being who appreciates others. Coming in for a solo birthday vacation from Florida, she made sure my stay was the best it could be. She successfully succeeded as soon as I walked in the front desk.

Additionally, the other front desk attendant was super accommodating as well. I forgot her name, but I just wanted to shout her out as well for the amazing experience.

The spa was wonderful as well! Ask for Randall, he was amazing!

This review would have had more stars but upon check in the glasses in the room were very dirty. Additionally when my boyfriend woke up the next morning we found a used condom by the side of the bed. Totally unacceptable. The operations manager did call to explain how this is not up to standard etc. which I did appreciate but just sucks. It was my birthday and not how I wanted to spend the day. Ended up checking out. Unfortunate situation. If you stay here please check the cleanliness of your rooms. Front desk staff was very nice and pleasant. Wish I had a better overall experience.

So, this was my first time in Virgina on a retreat and I wasn't expecting a hotel and spa in the middle of the city. From the outside it seems very old world, but inside of the hotel and spa is nice and quaint. The rooms are really nice and so is the service. My best advice to anyone going to it is to not judge this book by its cover.

I received a spa service and it was excellent. The therapist (Lily) delivered a relaxing / getting the knots out massage. She was professional and I felt refreshed when she was done. The Spa was very beautiful with many amenities. I will definitely visit again.

It was a dreary afternoon and I happened to be in the area and saw on the corner Joe Theismann’s, a salvation from the rain. I decided to give it a try. The hostess was exceptionally nice and we were seated immediately. The menu is pretty small but the beer menu is a bit larger. Everything on the menu seems to be carefully chosen. The reuben was very good and meaty. Brunch runs until 3pm and I got the honey chicken biscuit with smashed potatoes. The buffalo chicken sandwich is also excellent. The chocolate cake is worth a try and large enough to share, would highly recommend.

We had a surprise birthday party here and  it was amazing! The event staff was absolutely incredible. The space was really nice and they let us bring in a lot of stuff ahead of time to decorate it. The food was AMAZING! Honestly, waaaay better than what I was expecting. Absolutely delicious. The management was super patient with us and helped us a lot. The catering staff were super nice too and did a fantastic job. Absolutely phenomenal!

The staff was nice and food was good, but unbalanced in terms of salting. Some of the apps such as the onion rings and sweet potato tots were not that seasoned and almost bland if not for the sauces, whereas the steaks were overseasoned and didn't let the flavor of the meat come through. The cocktails and apple crumble dessert were very good. I recommend the Zinfandel to go with the steak.

We enjoyed our meals. We ordered 2  Joe's All-American burgers and naked wings. My daughter enjoyed her lemon 🍋 pepper wings. My husband and I enjoyed our burgers. Our waitress was friendly and professional. I ordered the Oaxaca Margarita and beware its spicy. I could not handle it and I love jalapeños Margarita. She was kind to let me trade this for a pink Cadillac Margarita. We will definitely be coming back again.

The staff were nice and welcoming. We got our table right away and were served drinks. The happy hour is excellent! Decent price, good portion, and of course great taste!

Side story: I removed my retainers and wrapped it in a paper towel. I forgot about it and left the restaurant. 20 mins later, i remembered and drove back. They cleaned up already but they were so nice to check out the trash and found it! I know it’s not their job to do that and i will forever be grateful they found it! Everyone was so nice!!

Food, environment, service, and people deserve 1000000/5 stars

This was my first time here is years. The food was just as great as I remembered. I had the escargot and the steak. They were absolutely great. The steak was cooked to perfection. Not under cooked and not over cooked. Just perfect. The hostess was very attentive to our wants and needs. After we were seated, we continued to have stellar service. We will certainly be back very soon.

Every time I go to the restaurant, I fall a little bit more in love.

Everything I selected was delicious, but the mushroom truffle risotto was divine.  The generous portion amount of truffles was not only appreciated but devoured with pleasure!

S/o to Larry, my waiter who was very attentive and immediately noticed what my preferences in wine were and kept my glass full all night.  Your service was much appreciated.

We enjoyed a beautiful Valentine’s meal with wine pairing.  The atmosphere was so welcoming and comfortable.  Everything was plated beautifully and tasted great.  I have to say my favorite item was the broccolini and carrots, I know that sounds like a odd thing to focus on but I’ve been to so many places that do not focus on cooking their veggies.  Let’s just say I could have eaten an entire plate 🥰.  Be sure to come hungry because the food is a little heavy so no dieters!  We will definitely be back!

Food was pretty good but nothing extraordinary. We had Sunday brunch this time. Feels like their regular dinner menu was better when visited several months ago. Server was polite. Atmosphere was pleasant, but felt a bit too close to the next tables. Street parking was easy, which was a bonus.

We went for restaurant week and it was hands down the best we've been too! We did the wine pairing as well, and it was definitely worth it! We were impressed with the staff, dazzled by the presentation and service and enjoyed every morsel of delicious food! We will definitely be back! ... update, 6months later we went back and every word still rings true!

Ordered online and walked from hotel to pick up my order.  It was easy to get to.  I think there is a few parking spots on street for pick up.

Pizza was tasty and I enjoyed it.  I ordered a specialty pizza.  Next time I'll try a custom pizza (wasn't obvious on the menu I looked at).  Is this a family business?  Staff was super friendly and I witnessed chatter with guests as they stopped to pick up pizza.  Clearly popular in the local community.

I would order from here again, but would like to see more variety of specialty pizzas or custom order (if it's not already available).

Went to Alexandria yesterday with my husband and friends, visited this restaurant, we love the pizza’s! We ordered meat lovers and deluxe and it was soo good and huge. We all love it, the owner and staff are nice and descent.. Highly recommend .

We had the cutest young waiter tonight. I think it may have been his second night of working because he had to organize and name and quantify every decision made from our 3 family, 11 person party. He really was a nice and kind waiter. We ordered drinks which were all bottled so there was no free refill. We hoped to order pizza by the slice as listed online and on their menu but because of COVID they did not offer pizza by the slice. We regrouped our orders and bought a few pies and other items like ravioli, salads and quesadillas. The food was good. The waiter was really nice. It was my birthday and I got a free dessert. I picked a piece of carrot cake and it was delicious! I shared it with the table and we all agreed the carrot cake was really great. We possibly stayed later than we should have. We left at 1030. I should have looked at their closing time! We were all just talking and enjoying company so we should have checked but they didn’t complain or kick us out!

If you are ever in Old Town Alexandria, you need to try the pizza here! 🍕

They have one of the best pizzas in town, and that means a great deal coming from a person who’s favorite food is pizza. 👀🤚🏼

I ordered the Bianca, which is basically a white pizza with different types of cheeses, Alfred white sauce, and basil leaves. It tastes SO good. ♥️

Not only do they have good food, but the staff is very friendly.

Thank you so much Kareema & Zakariya for being so kind and welcoming. ✨💕

My family and I had a wonderful experience.  It was my daughter's 13th birthday and 2 adults and 6 children were staying at the embassy suites hotel next door. The restaurant was the perfect walk (its right next door) for dinner.  Zack took great care of us and went out of his way to make sure that we had a great time.  The pizza was excellent and the location made it even more fun for the kids. To be honest,  some of the reviews made me nervous since this was my first visit, but the service and food ensures that we will definitely be back. Check it out for yourself.

After being closed for two years and opening up three weeks ago, I'm happy this place is as good as I remember. They got a new chef, but the food is still excellent and the cocktails are very tasty.

Friendly staff and great atmosphere!

Went to Vermilion for our anniversary and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our server Jose was fabulous and made a number of suggestions which were all excellent.  We ordered the croquettes, potatoes, beets, risotto, and casoncelli. All were delicious and sizeable portions. Will definitely be back!

We went for the first time since they reopened. They have a new head chef. I have to admit, we were sceptical because this was one of our favorite restaurants  pre-pandemic and we were concerned with the changes and how they may affect the quality that we had known to come and love.
I am happy to say, there is no doubt Chef Pflaumer, the new head chef, carries the torch and tradition with a menu that will leave you wanting more. We are more than lucky that you have found such a talented chef to run your kitchen. Chef  Pflaumer uses the freshest ingredients in a way that highlights their natural flavor and will dazzle even the most picky critics. Also, I'd like to mention our waiter, Zach. He was fantastic and was more than happy to provide us with suggestions and answers to any questions we had. He certainly did not disappoint. This is a bright, new chapter and I can't wait to see what's next. We'll definitely be going back every couple of weeks as the menu and season changes. We can't wait to see what Chef  Pflaumer treats us with next. Vermilion, just like the color it was named after, will dazzle and delight you. It's a must if you're anywhere close, or even if you're not. You must go, WILL NOT be disappointed and I promise, you will go back.
We revisited for a champagne and food pairing. We were the only guests in the upstairs dining room. This was a small craft champagne AND they even brought in the owner from France for the experience. Four champagnes, four courses of perfectly paired food. What more could you possibly ask for. Absolutely phenomenal.
First time back since reopening. It was excellent and we will be back. Great small plates and unique mains

I love this place and glad it re-opened.  Best place to eat and have drinks in Old Town.  This place never lets me or my friends down.  Will always be a repeat customer.  Please do not close again lol....

Great happy hour price for Irish beers! Came here for restaurant week 2022 and they gave a pretty great deal for $25. The clam chowder soup was good. The pork tenderloin tasted phenomenal! The Jameson cake was great as well. It’s a fun Irish Pub with a good atmosphere and I look forward to coming back. They’re probably my favorite Irish Pub for food/beer in the NOVA area.

I hadn't been in Murphy's in over 35 years. Wow. Nothing has changed. Except me. Rather than going in for a good ole Irish drunk with my buds, I was taking my 25 year old out for dinner. I hadn't been on King Street but maybe twice in the past 30 years and since I had some time to kill before catching my Amtrak, I thought it would be fun to check things out and show the kid around. What a treat of a time. We had a fantastic dinner. Shrimp appetizer was incredible, shepherds pie was perfect, and the broiled salmon was out of this world. I don't think we could have gone wrong with anything on the menu. The atmosphere is exactly what you would hope for in an Irish pub: lively, but not so loud you can't enjoy your own conversation. Probably the biggest grin I got was passing by the kitchen on my way to the upstairs restrooms and overhearing the beautifully unintelligible to me brogue. Ah, nothing like the fine mix of old and new memories.

Great atmosphere. Very friendly and attentive staff. Appropriate selection of beers and ale. But I was VERY disappointed in the food. A place called Murphy's should know the difference between a Shepherd's Pie and a Cottage Pie. The Meat and Potato pie was unlike any pie I ever had in Ireland, or anywhere else. The food is a bad joke. I may go back for a beverage but I'll buy my Irish food elsewhere.

Stopped in for drinks and appetizers.  Live music started at around 9, so we stayed for that.  It was a fun place to people watch.  Place is a little small.  Bathrooms were clean, unisex downstairs, men and women restrooms upstairs.  Plenty of craft beers and Irish fare.

Stopped in to watch the Argentina/Mexico World Cup game and grab a couple of beers.

Great ambience, the walls are covered with the patches of police (& Fire?) Departments from all over the country. The place is obviously a local landmark and as such it's the beer & ambience that are key here.

Ordered the French Dip after the locals on either side of me steered me away from my first choice (Fish and Chips). It was okay. Edible but nothing to write home about.

The quality of the meat was a little subpar. Definitely not made there and about what you'd expect from a chain sandwich shop.

But like I said, I don't think this is the kind of place you patron for the food.

Other notable things:
- Service was pleasant and attentive.
- Live music is offered weekly.
- Guinness and Black & Tans were perfect for the afternoon.

What a delight! It was a cold winter's night as we walked briskly along the streets of Old Town Alexandria. Coming into this charming, warm restaurant was a very welcome change. The decor is lovely, the service very good and the food is tasty. We were very happy with our whole meal. It is both kid friendly and a fun hangout for adults, which is hard to accomplish. We recommend going for a nice dinner or just a drink at their inviting bar.
P.S. The biscuits were almost worth fighting over!

Fab brunch in the old Fire Station in Alexandria. Bit pricey but the food is delicious. Highly recommend the hash. Good bottomless coffee too. We turned up without a reservation, but most other good places in town you needed to book. Fab selection of beers too.

We visited this place late on a Sunday, they had the bar menu available for food. Great variety of drinks; we ordered the Firehouse burger which came with cheese, bacon, garlic aioli and BLT, it was a decent burger specially for a late night menu, it didn't have a lot of flavor but it wasn't bad. The service was great and order came out fast.

This place is amazing, our new go-to place when guests come into town. One of the few places in old town Alexandria that has not fallen into the trap of mediocrity due to the high volume of visitors (like the majority of the restaurants in old town unfortunately).

Everything we ate was excellent, HOWEVER the Thai Curry Mussels were the highlight of the meal. Simple yet unique, defiantly a must try.

Then if the food and atmosphere were not enough our server Bianca just made the night. She was helpful, upbeat, and simply wonderful.

Oh and they have a legit happy hour as well.

Fun atmosphere and delicious food. Make sure to ask to sit in the enclosed patio, and enjoy the exposed brick walls and old decor. The prices are on the pricier side, but the food was great. Definitely get the melted jack cheese as an appetizer.

A bit crowded inside but there’s a good atmosphere for dinner. Make sure you make a reservation. The bread doesn’t come with the meal so we ordered it and it was served hot in its little cast iron dish. We got two salmons, one was cooked perfect and the other we sent back but was promptly fixed. The side of potatoes were good but nothing special. Our waiter was really nice and friendly. Management was very attentive, walking around and making sure everything was okay.

This place was fabulous! The service was outstanding. The hot cider cocktail was perfect for the chilly day. We really enjoyed the ribs and the lamb kofte. The pork chop & hanger steak dinners were very nice, and good size portions. The "off-menu" vegetarian option was rice and some green vegetables, while it was good, it left a lot to be desired in comparison to the traditional menu items. Would go with a salad in the future. The chocolate bread pudding was a wonderful end to the evening.

This is an Old Fashioned kind of place.
I wandered into The Majestic just before closing, coming off a long cross-country flight. I was hungry and just wanted a warm atmosphere and a good meal. The waitress at the bar immediately made me feel welcome, recommending multiple things on the menu. The goat cheese stuffed dates were delicious, and the salmon was perfect. Crispy on the bottom with delicate layers on top of a savory rice and corn base. Great place, I highly recommend.

The majestic was fantastic! It helped that it was a beautiful day and we sat outside. The server gave great recommendations - the pork chop and salmon were both delicious. The bread really stole the show, too! Altogether a very positive experience. Great location, too! We'll be back!

Wonderful restaurant!  We went here for brunch and it was so good!

We got the flight mimosa - it gives you an entire bottle of champagne and mimosa juices for $42+.  But it's totally worth it.

I got the salmon eggs benedict and it was delicious.  And of course, we shared the famous monkey bread.  You can't go here and miss out on this!!

Other than the food, service and atmosphere are wonderful as well.  Totally recommend stopping by here.  But I do recommend a reservation, because it can get a bit busy.  Try doing it for a Sunday brunch - it's great!

Last thought - it's a little pricey but worth the experience.  Food and service are great!

Delicious food! The mussels were a bit spicy, but love them. The croquettes spume was very interesting. The short rib and the lamb chops were cooked to perfection. That lamb almost melted in your mouth. The bar area looked more interesting than the dining area. The dining area feels a bit sterile, needs a bit more.of ambiance and the chairs.of.the table are a bit low. If you are not very tall sit in the tables with the regular chairs. 😆

We went for restaurant week, and it was definitely a good deal! One of our meals was better than the other, but overall no complaints. They were out of a few of the wines we wanted, but the wine selection was fabulous! We really enjoyed the atmosphere, the staff were all wonderful and extremely nice! We'll definitely be back!

**Great Service, Great Food**

After coming here around 6:30pm, the restaurant had a great vibe. The appearance is well lit and very clean. The service was very organized and presentable. Servers were very experienced and presented the specials for the day. The food was a bit spicy, but one of the most amazing foods I've ever had along with the drink and dessert. The price was a bit high, but don't let that ward you away.

**Overall, the great food and service is worth paying for.**

We went for Alexandria Restaurant Week, the atmosphere was really nice, simple but elegant, lovely and calm.

I particularly recommend the mussels, they were extremely good as well as the steak frites. The macarons dessert was great, very large portions.

The service was attentive and friendly. The food was really very very good, we all really enjoyed what we ordered.

Brabo is our favorite restaurant in Alexandria! Better than other French restaurants we’ve tried in the DC area. We’ve been several times and everything is superb - steak, scallops, beef bourguignon, duck. So much flavor and cooked to perfection. Also a great spot for cocktails 👌🏼 we’ve only been for dinner but would love to try their brunch!
I don’t eat Mexican or Hispanic food much. But this chipotle is one of the best place to get good food and healthy food. Their rice bowl is amazing. Their salsa and chopped chicken is very delicious.
My salad was watery and they forgot the rice and steak. This was a take out order. I should’ve checked before I left.

Recently, the portions sizes and service has not been up to usual chipotle standards. I have been a frequent customer at this location and have not had any complaints until the last few months. As a frequent chipotle customer at different locations, im quite familiar with the portion sizes, I understand that with the rising cost of products, the portions have been reduced in most chipotles however this location has taken it too far. When ordering a quesadilla, the server places less than a handful of cheese (almost a little more than a pinch) and when i asked her for more she said she would charge me extra. Like I said before, I understand the cost of produce is high now but charging extra for the bare minimum is unacceptable, I will no longer return to this location as this same experience has happened to me each time I have returned the past few months.
As good as chipotle! They open until 10pm!
Really nice employees and patient. I was on the phone asking another person what they wanted and they never made me feel rushed. Serving size was great. Place was clean.

- food was really good, lots of flavor and everything was fresh.

- their different Chili's were all good, but would have to say the vegetarian & Cincinnati chili were the best. The Texas chili would be my 3rd favorite then theirTerlingua red which is spicy but honestly not really spicy at all.

- first time here and they gave us cornbread and samples of all 4 chilli's. We liked all the different chilli's and the cornbread was extremely good as well.

- place was clean and organized.

- service was quick and servers did a good job checking the right amount of times where it was not annoying or wondering where they went off too.

- plenty of seating and they were not really busy when we had went there for lunch around 2pm

- all their staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

- prices not bad for the area and you get a decent amount of food for what you pay for.

- parking in old town is always hit or miss depending on what's going on in the area but there is parking closed to the location.

- nice atmosphere inside and had a welcoming feeling.

- over a really nice first experience, I would recommend this location.

Was fine for what it was... a bar with greasy hangover food.  I will say some of the best cornbread I've ever eaten.  They also have four different chilis they make and the server gave us a small sampler when we told him we had never been there before.  They serve chili over spaghetti, which is an odd combo but apparently their specialty.  Waiter was attentive, place wasn't crowded.  Kids didn't care for the food, wings or fries, which is odd- but the chili is pretty good.  It's a bar... so like I said, it's fine for what it is.

Stopped in for lunch to see if it lived up to the claims of the best Chili in Virginia, it didn't disappoint. A first time visit gets you a little chili sampler to try the four different chilis they offer.  Each one offering its own unique taste

The cornbread chili meal was hearty and delicious. Mac and cheese bites were perfection. My Fiance ordered the grilled old bay wings and they were incredible. Some had a little to much burn on them but that was the only small negative thing to say.

Friendly, efficient service and good food. The chili is excellent, and they have a few different variations. I usually get spaghetti with chili (5-way), although on this visit I got chili with rice. It has kind of a dive-y feel, but it’s great. Good for families and adults.

It is hard not to like simmering chili and corn bread.  Hard Times cafe makes it easy with something simple but good.  I had a choice between the Texas and Cincinnati style.  Plus you choose your topping and I went for the cheese.  So good.  Nice way to spend a Sunday.

Five Guys is the best burger fast food place. You pay a bit more but you get quite a bit more. Plus, Cajun fries make my mouth water. I had one shake and then ordered another to go. I don't do that many places. Did you know you can do a lettuce wrap instead of a bun? Drop in and enjoy!

It's Five Guys, so there's not much insight I can add. Food was good. Restaurant was clean and they gave out free peanuts which is a plus. HOWEVER, this is not the place to go to get a deal anymore. Each burger costs about $10! For 2 people with no drinks/milk shakes it cost $30! For a family with kids, this is easily going to be a $50+ dollar meal. I feel bad for the working families out there because this is pricy. Five Guys is no longer a good value.

Cashier super rude. The display doesn't show toppings on burger. So I asked to confirm toppings. He just kept asking if I wanted fries are a drink. Then he became agitated because I asked about toppings. I was the only customer in the store. I won't be back. In fact I won't be back to any five guys. This second time.

Simply the best. Best fries. Best burger. Best staff. Best everything. My experience here today was very pleasant. My order was taken quickly and smoothly. The food was more than awesome. Tip: Cajun fries are totally worth trying (order the large cause you can never have enough).

Not sure what the fuss is about. Heard many great things about this place and it did not live up to expectations. Disappointed. Had lunch with my mom and nephews and found the food and shakes expensive and overrated.

Best Greek food I've ever had in the US.  Fresh and incredible.  They have a huge range of authentic dishes and all 5 of us tried something different and all were fantastic.  My only regret is that i didnt leave enough room for dessert.  The sampler dinner was amazing and so filling... we loved it.  The decor is great and the staff is friendly and attentive.  We loved it!  Looking forward to our next visit!

This was without a doubt the best Greek food I've ever had.  Maybe best restaurant of any kind.  I started with their thick red gazpacho which was wonderful.  Absolutely amazing.  Then a simple Greek salad and then a gyro.  Simple but beautiful and delicious.  Great service and atmosphere.  Loved it.  5 stars.

A very pretty restaurant, with a lovely patio garden. Service was superb. We celebrated my birthday with a lunch. We had grilled octopus, taramasalata, and saganaki for appetizers followed by grilled lamb chops, salmon and avocado stuffed with crabmeat. We enjoyed each dish very much. We shared one dessert (enough for the 3 of us) as we were stuffed after our meal. Dessert was alright...I would try something else next time. We had Galaktoboureko.
I had a very lovely time dining with friends. The menu offers not just Greek but Turkish and other dishes throughout the mediterranean. Very authentic food made with love.

My husband & I spent our anniversary weekend in Old Town Alexandria & had a wonderful dinner at Taverna Cretekou. The grill octopus appetizer was perfect in flavor as well as the flaming cheese!  The grilled lamb kabobs were cooked to perfection!  Staff were pleasant, attentive & provided a great service.

Simply amazing food and service! Wyndham resorts recommended it as the best Italian restaurant in the area so we thought we would give it a try.

Our party of 6 walked in, a background trio was playing softly and water and buns were immediately put onto the table. Our server Joe came by and made some excellent recommendations! Hangar steak, the salmon dish and the wild mushroom pasta were simply amazing! Then the lemon tart and the carrot cake did not disappoint!

I liked the fact that Joe said he has tried everything on the menu and instantly gave us his top 3 favorites. He said he and his roommate eat there frequently which says quite a lot for a restaurant.

I highly recommend giving it a try if your in the area. If it's anything like our experience, you will not be disappointed!

We absolutely loved our brunch experience today at Laporta's.  The food was exceptional, the atmosphere very comfortable and the service was impeccable.  Today's Sunday Brunch featured a tented guitarist that set just the right ambience for the afternoon.

Kay had the perfectly done scallops and angel hair pasta and I had the seafood crepe.  Photos attached.  We were tempted by the pecan pie and shared an absolutely amazing slice -- and concluded our meal by trying to figure out how the chef had managed an absolutely perfect crust.  Run, don't walk to this delightful restaurant.  We're coming back!

First time here and they didn’t disappoint. The food was fabulous and the atmosphere was so pleasant. Smooth Jazz over the delicious crab cakes. Everyone enjoyed the evening and it was a great pre Father’s Day dinner. Kudos to everyone.

Had date night here and loved it. Everything from the food, drinks, service and live music was amazing. This is definitely a place worth visiting. Noise level is a little high w the live music but nothing outrageous. The place is clean and they have free parking in the garage directly behind the restaurant. Great place overall!

I love coming here, another spot that I have so many wonderful memories from back in the day. A real staple of Old Town Alexandria, today we had two cocktails and burrata salad, absolutely so glad we stumbled back in here after a couple years. Love their pasta, salads, cocktails, desserts, service, always a pleasure to come back here. Lori was our bartender today and she was exemplary, attentive, knowledgable, professional, cannot wait to be back when she works!

SO SO GOOD!!  I love me some yellow curry and they have some of the best I’ve ever had! Our waiter was so helpful and attentive. I live in the pacific north west or I’d frequent the hell out of this place. If you like Thai you should eat here. Even if you don’t…you should give them a try!

Came here during a drop off to college and it was a nice find.  Thw Drunken Noodles were super hot and had a really good bite of spices.  The spicy beef salad (sorry forgot the menu name)  was also really good.  The restaurant it self is quite large I can see it getting very busy during the business week at lunch time.

A friend and I walked in this winter and found it to be a great lunch. I shared I had gluten intolerance and three staff members consulted for my meal. There is no allergen information listed on the menu, but there is a line about informing the server about dietary restrictions at the bottom of it. They were eager to make dietary accommodations to the existing menu: they made the tofu pad thai a gluten free entree and also edited the spring rolls for a gluten intolerant person: they removed the sausage and added more veggies and rice noodles. I also asked for hot water and my friend cold and they made sure to refill each with the right temps. I recommend diners enjoy Pasara Thai on their next opportunity.

Wow, really good! I just needed some good food after a long travel day and Thai sounded great. Couldn’t have asked for better food, ordered the Panang Chicken Curry and it was phenomenal. Flavors were on-point and the spice level was perfect. I can imagine some folks would think it too spicy and some not enough but it was perfectly balanced imo. Certainly worth stopping by, other options looked great too but my go-to is the Panang Chicken and it did not disappoint!

Currently on vacation and decided to try something different tonight. The hostess recommended the Pineapple Fried Rice and I can honestly say this is the best fried rice I've ever had! If I was staying longer, I'd come back. But the food and atmosphere is phenomenal! A+

Something different for a change. Food was delicious, flavorful and the drinks were strong!! I had the chicken shawarmaand that was really good while my friend and the lamb.  Five minutes wait on a walk-in. We were seated outside in tent since the inside was reserved for private party. Good thing the weather wasn't too bad on a Saturday. They do offer hookah at your table as well.

We enjoy the food every time I come here for lunch! We usually order a variety of appetizers to share “tapas style,” and everything we try is always delicious! Plenty of outdoor seating and friendly staff!

My first visit was there. Nice ambiance. Staffs were very friendly and helpful.
The food was too small in quantity compared to price. Everything was very expensive. Food taste is moderate.

This is a very nice place if you’re craving Lebanese food!

I ordered the shish tawouk shawerma combo that came with fries and a soda. It was really delicious.

I did ask for some pickles and they charged me $6 for it.

Our waitress was clearly new and she was little overwhelmed and all over the place. Even though me and my friend asked for 2 separate checks, we had to return the bill two times because the orders on the bill were mixed up.

All in all, I liked the food and atmosphere of the restaurant. I recommend sitting outside if you’re visiting; they have a nice outside seating area.
Great service, lovely inside room and very spacious they have outside sitting very big as well. Food was delicious and great service.

It was my first time at this restaurant yesterday afternoon and it was a great experience. Wait staff were actually nice and accommodating to my date and I. There were open seats available outside as well. Funny and entertaining waiter as well. Good Mediterranean food! The only opportunity would be the one parking spot to be moved up from our outdoor table but that might be outside of the restaurants control. Overall, I would recommend this place for Mediterranean spot in Old Town.

Love the food. One of the best Lebanese places that I have tasted. Had the ayran, it was good, The veg combination platter was amazing and the baklava was to die for! It would have been better if the waiter had more knowledge of the food items!

It's a little hard to find the sign. The food was ok for the dishes we got. I got sujak ( acquired taste )  and eggplant,chickpeas and garlic sauce  which was drenched in the saur garlic sauce ( little too much sauce ). The appetizer meat was great. I would recommend staying away from Sujak and trying Turkish coffee.  Good customer service and plenty of tables.

Great food and service. We went on a Saturday evening during Thanksgiving holidays and still got very friendly service. They have a vegetarian entree section and many other vegetarian appetizers. Food is delicious, and also somewhat different from other Mediterranean restaurants. Some vegan options too. Will visit again!

Dine out on historic King St or inside this quaint restaurant serving authentic Lebanese cuisine. Amazing vegetarian options in a relaxing environment. Highly recommend getting a platter so long as you don't miss what may be the best falafel in Virginia.

Hit or miss service - have had to leave at times because of the terribly slow service.

Best place around for breakfast. The food is fantastic and very affordable. French toast is to die for. The biscuits and gravy have a nice little spiced twist to them. I don't know where they source their strawberries but they're consistently top notch and fresh. The staff is very friendly, service is fast, and the environment is very quaint and inviting. I've been here more times than I can count, both with people, or on my own to just have a nice breakfast, some coffee, and to read a book.

My wife had the Eggs Benedict over Crab Cakes, I had the New York Steak and Eggs. Both dishes came with the Breakfast Potatoes seasoned perfectly. New York Strip was exactly to my Order. My wife loved the Crab 🦀 Cakes. The sauce over Eggs Benedict is complex she'll have it on the side next time to eat. Overall the Service was excellent the Food Was Served Hot Fresh and ready to Devour. Fresh Squeezed OJ recommended also. Thank you all at TableTalk Restaurant!!!!!!

First off, the food was tasty.

Attention to detail was lacking. My eggs were overcooked in my eggs Benedict. My friend didn't receive toast and chips with their meal and had to ask for them. My wife also asked for gravy on the side of her open faced sandwich.

I love all the green inside the restaurant! The food was fine. Prepared well but nothing special about the ingredients. Ordinary sandwich bread for the toast. I was told the corned beef hash comes from a can. But coming here was a nice way to start my day.
First time ever coming here. Definitely will be coming back. The garbage omelette was good. But the home fried potatoes was the absolute best!!

Love this Starbucks! They always get my order correct and are super friendly! I rarely deviate from my usual Mocha Cookie Frappuccino so it’s pretty neat when they recognize me or know me by name based on my recurring order.  This store is my happy place!

This has been my go-to location for about a year. Initially, they made my iced shaken espresso with way too much foam that they didn't scoop out to pour the actual drink to a legitimage venti size that I was paying for, but eventually, they got there for about 80% of the time I visit.

They're quick and efficient. Very friendly from when I go at 6am, or if I go at 6pm. I recommend this location despite the disaster of parking.
Stopped in for a drink. Staff was nice. I hope that Starbuck's corporate pays their employees more money and give them better benefits so they don't have to strike.
Got a pumpkin spice latter just now and for some reason it tastes like soap!? So far it’s been less than mediocre coffee. Not sure if it’s the employees or just the quality of coffee detonating

Alexis did way too much talking with her coworkers which caused me to have to wait 20 mins to order. There was only one other customer in the store at the time. There was no reason for the delay. She didn’t even apologize for the wait.
The best Chinese food I have found while loving out here. The orange chicken tested like fresh oranges and everything was high quality in terms of freshness. Excellent and highly recommended!

Nothing to shout about, it’s just a little neighborhood Chinese cafe. I ordered the Chicken & Eggplant in Garlic Sauce dish, it was just okay. The server did not even check on my satisfaction although I was the only guest at that time. The ladies were too busy chatting among themselves. In addition, their ad about wine list was very misleading. There was no list nor menu, I was verbally offered red or white wines. Won’t be back.
This place has very friendly staff, food prep is fast and the food is good. I had to go back for a second time after my initial visit the day prior.

The place was quiet. We ate here for Chines New years. It was small and peaceful to eat in with 4 loud kids. The price was average for the area. It seemed a little pricey for me. Other than that the food had flavor for American style Chinese dinning. They treated us good for a busy rainy Sunday Night.

Good, fast and inexpensive food. When you need something quick, because you do not feel like cooking, this is the place to visit. Good entre options that come out quickly. You can eat in the restaurant or take it to-go. Not a place for a first date, or special occasions, but if Domino's Pizza next door will not cut it, pop your head here and you will not be disappointed.
